headline: Restaurant Chains Are Forecasting Better Results This Year. Here's Why Investors Should Think Twice About Believing Them
summary: It's been a tough start to the year for restaurant chains.  People are scaling back on spending due to uncertain economic conditions, and restaurants aren't able to simply rely on price hikes to boost their top lines anymore.  Here's why they could be wrong, and why investors may want to exercise caution when looking at buying restaurant stocks right now.

headline: Chipotle upgraded, Charter initiated: Wall Street’s top analyst calls
summary: The most talked about and market moving research calls around Wall Street are now in one place. Here are today’s research calls that investors need to know, as compiled by The Fly. headline: 1 Stock-Split Stock to Buy Hand Over Fist in March and 1 to Avoid
summary: Stock splits have an interesting narrative.  In actuality, stock splits have no impact on a company's financial performance.  After a forward stock split (where a company's shares outstanding grow) or a reverse stock split (where shares outstanding contract), a company's total shares outstanding will change, but it is still the same old business as the day before.
